result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Louis Dewitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges/restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Complete a vocational training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Seek and maintain full time or part time employment or in the alternative, apply for SSI benefits.

Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Take all medications as prescribed.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended Supervision. 
Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random urine screens.

Pay restitution for child suport arrears and accumulated interest in  the amount of $25,035.94 at a rate of $150.00 per month payable thrugh the Wisconsin Support Collection Fund (WI-SCTF).  To make a good faith effort to pay regular and consistent payments.  
**Same language/order on 09CF111 case.  Assessment/amount on 09CF111 case.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at probation department's discretion.  Consecutive to condition ordered in case 09CF111.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by:  victims, Felicia S. and Connie W.


AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS, concurrent to case# 09CF111.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS. 
Credit given for 376 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" - STAYED to be used at the Probation Department's discretion.  This condition time is CONSECUTIVE to the condition time ordered in case# 09CF111.
* Complete a vocational training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Seek and maintain full-time or part-time employment OR, in the alternative, apply for SSI benefits.
* Take all medications as prescribed.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution for child support arrears and accumulated interest in the amount of $25,035.94 at a rate of $150.00 per month payable through the Wisconsin Support Collection Fund (WI-SCTF).  Defendant is to make a good faith effort to pay regular and consistent payments.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court referred defendant to the mental health unit.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Roger L Dewitt in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Courtfound defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.

Case adjourned to 05-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.

INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $968.75 to Dr.Rawski for services on 01-13-15, 01-14,15, 01-15-15, 01-19-15.
COPY IN FILE.

Parties remain in a trial posture.
There are no discovery issues at this time.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 04-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.

No objections.
Court GRANTS request.

State moves to consolidate case# 09CF111 and case# 14CF354.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request and ordered case# 09CF111 and case# 14CF354 consolidated for purposes of trial.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 03-20-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 04-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Roger Louis Dewitt in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Defendant Roger Louis Dewitt in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on return on doctor's 2nd NGI report.

**Defense withdraws the NGI plea today.

for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.

Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for return on doctor's NGI report.
Atty. Lisa Procaccio is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
The NGI report does not support the NGI plea.
Atty. Procaccio requests a 2nd opinion.
Court GRANTS request.
Court ordered defendant to submit to a 2nd NGI evaluation with Dr. Robert Rawski.
Court continued the suspension of the proceedings.
Case adjourned to 01-21-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Return on Doctor's NGI Report.

NGI Report as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Deborah Collins; filed.
for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.
filed by ADA Maureen Atwell on behalf of the State.

Attorney Scott David Obernberger in court, defendant Roger L Dewitt NOT in court, in custody.  Garrett Soberalski for Maureen Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of his client. Court ACCEPTS special plea.  Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as to the special plea. Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.

Defendant Roger Louis Dewitt in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  William Berens for Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Defendant Roger L Dewitt in custody.  Maureen A Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Atty. Vega moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant; Atty. Vega and the defendant have a breakdown in communication.
No objections.
Statements made.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Vega to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Eric Vega is now discharged.
Atty. Vega to ensure that new counsel is appointed by the next court date.
Case adjourned to 07-21-2014 at 1:30 PM for Status of Counsel.

Attorney Eric M Vega appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the defendant.  Defendant Roger L Dewitt not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Maureen A Atwell appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a projected Plea Hearing date.

Defendant Roger L Dewitt in court with attorney Eric Vega.  Defendant Roger L Dewitt IN CUSTODY.  Maureen A Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court WITHDRAWS the outstanding bench warrant today.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Court addressed bail:  Court continued the cash bail at $250.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point.  Same conditions as previously ordered.

Court ordered case adjourned to 06-03-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Scheduling Conference.

FILED, signed Order to Cancel Warrant.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roger Louis Dewitt in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Roger Louis Dewitt in custody.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
